paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses a case of pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma associated with a germline BRCA2 mutation and reviews literature on BRCA2 mutations in similar cases.

patients.demographics: Mean age 62 years (SD: 8.7; range: 50–78), 7 males (67%), 3 females (33%)

individual_records.phenotype_details: Pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma with extensive intraductal growth.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 52-year-old man carrying a germline BRCA2 mutation presented with steatorrhea, abdominal pain and weight loss.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is considered pathogenic by ClinVar and indicates loss of the wild-type allele.

variants.segregation_data: Loss of the wild-type BRCA2 allele was detected in all cases with known zygosity.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence due to multiple case reports and literature review.
variants.additional_notes: All specified BRCA2 mutations were truncating.
key_quotes: Loss of the wild-type BRCA2 allele, observed in all cases with known zygosity, supports the causal relation between BRCA2 germline mutation and the onset of ACC.

tables_processed.table_caption: Germline BRCA1/2 mutations in pancreatic ACCs.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant data was clearly presented in the text and tables.
